title: Shadow armor
summaries: Shadow armor is an armor set that consists of the Shadow Helmet, Shadow Scalemail, and Shadow Greaves. The individual pieces provide a total of 19 defense, equal to its Crimson counterpart, Crimson armor.

On <linked>[img:Desktop version]</linked><linked> Desktop</linked>, <linked>[img:Console version]</linked><linked> Console</linked>, and <linked>[img:Mobile version]</linked><linked> Mobile</linked>, each of the 3 pieces provide a +5% boost to universal <linked>critical strike chance</linked> (for a total of +15%), while wearing all 3 pieces at once grants an additional set bonus of +15% <linked>movement speed</linked> and acceleration.

On <linked>[img:Old-gen console version]</linked><linked> Old-gen console</linked>, <linked>3DS</linked><linked>[img:Nintendo 3DS version]</linked>, and <linked>[img:Legacy tModLoader version]</linked><linked> Legacy tModLoader</linked>, each of the 3 pieces provide a +7% boost to melee <linked>attack speed</linked> (for a total of +21%), while wearing all 3 pieces at once grants an additional set bonus of +15% <linked>movement speed</linked>.

Wearing a full set causes the player to display an afterimage effect during motion (similar to <linked>Necro armor</linked>), emit shadow particles, and will cause the <linked>Rocket Boots</linked> to emit purple flames (this does not occur with <linked>Spectre Boots</linked> or any of its derivatives).
Crafting a full set requires a total of 60 Demonite Bars (180 / 240 Demonite Ore) and 45 Shadow Scales. Defeating the Eater of Worlds twice can provide enough to craft a full set.

Shadow armor pieces are interchangeable with pieces from the <linked>Ancient Shadow armor</linked> set, while still providing the same 15% increased movement speed set bonus, but not the afterimage effect.
